item.title: Controversies galore Arjuna Awards panel seldom hits target plumb
item.description: By belittling sportspersons to pander to influence instead of achievement the Arjuna committees have done great disservice to the sporting community over the years writes Sukhwant Basra
item.itunes:subtitle: By belittling sportspersons to pander to influence instead of achievement the Arjuna committees have done great disservice to the sporting community over the years writes Sukhwant Basra

item.title: Guardians of the Galaxy marks the advent of rogue superheroes
item.description: An outlaw a green assassin a tattooed wrestler a raccoon and a tree set out to steal a decorated orb but end up forming an improbable fellowship of superheroes in the exquisite film Guardians of the Galaxy which is set in alien worlds
item.itunes:subtitle: An outlaw a green assassin a tattooed wrestler a raccoon and a tree set out to steal a decorated orb but end up forming an improbable fellowship of superheroes in the exquisite film Guardians of the Galaxy which is set in alien worlds

item.title: Smriti Iranis political ascent is not cosmetic
item.description: As democracy matures it strikes at the hereditary sources of power In future Indian democracy will propel milkmen drivers and mechanics to power frequently they will make mistakes and might not differentiate a degree from a certificate writes Tufail Ahmad
item.itunes:subtitle: As democracy matures it strikes at the hereditary sources of power In future Indian democracy will propel milkmen drivers and mechanics to power frequently they will make mistakes and might not differentiate a degree from a certificate writes Tufail Ahmad

item.title: Modi touched upon common issues in IDay speech but like a trueblue PM
item.description: Narendra Modi rose above partisan politics on Independence Day and spoke the way a Prime Minister should His first address from the Red Fort was a study in reconciliation and empathy writes Vinod Sharma
item.itunes:subtitle: Narendra Modi rose above partisan politics on Independence Day and spoke the way a Prime Minister should His first address from the Red Fort was a study in reconciliation and empathy writes Vinod Sharma

item.title: Silicon Valley must be on Modis itinerary
item.description: The impending visit of Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the United States to attend the United Nations General Assembly and also to meet US President Barack Obama will be a significant step to set the tone and outcomes of USIndia relations

item.title: Tectonic changes that will shake up our world
item.description: The contradicting statistics in HTMaRS Youth Survey for example 61 of Indias young feel that premarital sex is longer a taboo in India yet an equal number 63 expect their husbandwife to be a virgin accurately reflect the confused state of mind of a young society in flux

item.title: August 15 is not just about the Red Fort speech
item.description: It is not merely the choreography of official Independence Day that needs repair What could be far more consequential are the reasons why in the mind of an influential section of India the Republic is a notch above the nation

item.title: MOOCs could be the answer for worlds largest student population
item.description: Anbsp few months ago IITBombay launched three MOOCs Massive Open Online Courses Introduction to Computer Programming Part 1 and 2 and Thermodynamics With this India has truly stepped into the MOOCs era
item.itunes:subtitle: Anbsp few months ago IITBombay launched three MOOCs Massive Open Online Courses Introduction to Computer Programming Part 1 and 2 and Thermodynamics With this India has truly stepped into the MOOCs era

item.title: Tilt the power balance in favour of the poor
item.description: India is a vast country and every year either the quantity or the distribution of rainfall is deviant in one part or the other Moreover Indian farming is still predominantly rainfed In such a scenario the MGNREGA can do two very important jobs Drought relief and drought mitigation

item.title: After Modis Nepal visit what changed and what did not
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is known for speedy execution of projects It is to be seen if what India has committed to doing in Nepal gets translated into realitynbspModi returns to Nepalnbspin November for the SAARC summit The real challenge is to sustain the atmpspherics and get rolling on the substance in the next four months

item.title: Is BJP pushing to form majority govt in JampK
item.description: Within two months Prime Minister Narendra Modi has already visited Jammu and Kashmir twice reflecting the BJPs push to form a majority government in Jammu and Kashmir in the upcoming assembly polls scheduled later this year
item.itunes:subtitle: Within two months Prime Minister Narendra Modi has already visited Jammu and Kashmir twice reflecting the BJPs push to form a majority government in Jammu and Kashmir in the upcoming assembly polls scheduled later this year

item.title: Narendra Modis outreach without borders
item.description: Focused and sustained followup will be the key to taking IndiaNepal ties to the next level writes Rajiv Kumar

item.title: We need to tick all the right boxes next time
item.description: The way Prime Minister Narendra Modi remained defiant despite the lastminute efforts of the visiting US secretary of state John Kerry gives us hope This is the first time an Indian prime minister has stood rock solid behind his team of negotiators

item.title: Narendra Modis tough talk on Pakistans proxy war may undermine Nawaz Sharif
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modis remarks Tuesday that Pakistan had lost the power to fight a conventional war and instead is waging proxy war on India is unlikely to go down well in Islamabad

item.title: A learning experience for Smriti Irani education isnt just Yale degree
item.description: The ferocious debate over the HRD ministers educational qualification and whether she is fit to be the Union HRD minister has been on since the day she took over the ministry Is her CV impressive enough for the job she holds
